job description:
As Data Engineer you’ll be working on our data processing pipeline: collecting, analyzing and transforming billions of data points in order to make this data accessible to our Data Science and Application Engineering teams. You’ll be using your experience building large-scale data systems to design processes that scale up as our data grows and allow us to utilize our infrastructure efficiently.

Responsibilities:
  • Designing and building scalable systems that can collect, store, retrieve and transform data coming from a variety of different sources including APIs, Postgres, Solr, S3, message queues and Apache Cassandra.
  • Selecting appropriate data storage and retrieval methods and technologies.
  • Designing data-structures and optimizing queries that deal with millions of rows of data.
  • Creating reusable and maintainable code, automated tests and clear documentation.
  • Optimizing your code to run in a high-performance real time environment that generates billions of data points a day.
  • Supporting the software and systems you write and deploy in our production environment.
  • Collaborating across engineering, product and data teams to solve technical and business issues.
Requirements:
  • 4+ years experience building and scaling Python-based data processing systems in a Linux environment.
  • Expertise working with Apache Spark clusters.
  • Experience working with data originating from multiple sources: RDBMS, APIs, text files, messages queues.
  • Expertise working with RDBMS, including schema design, writing SQL for complex multi-table queries and optimizing query performance.
  • Experience writing automated tests for your own code, as well as data validation tests to ensure accuracy.
  • Expertise in using Git and Git branching models.
  • You enjoy working as a part of a collaborative team and demonstrate an open mindset.
  • Strong communication skills: able to clearly articulate, defend and document design decisions and work with a cross-discipline team.
  • A love of problem solving and a sense of imagination.
Other valuable skills:
  • Experience working with distributed data stores like Cassandra or Hadoop HDFS.
  • Experience with Spark ML or Spark Streaming.
  • Experience working with message queues, like RabbitMQ or Kafka.
  • Experience designing schemas for efficiently indexing and searching content in Solr or Elasticsearch.
  • Familiarity with AWS (specifically EC2, EBS, and S3)
  • Experience in ad technologies and/or the online advertising space.
